entry.title: Guardian Caps (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the NFL has required players in most positions to wear Guardian Caps (pictured) during training even though third-party research has questioned their effectiveness?

entry.title: Watamou Lamien (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Upper Voltan National Radio chief editor Watamou Lamien was the liaison between the ROC group of young radical military officers and the clandestine Voltan Revolutionary Communist Party?

entry.title: Silence Is Loud (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Silence Is Loud uses a style that was previously considered "absolutely verboten" for its genre?

entry.title: Jacob Green Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jackson Demonstration State Forest was named in honor of American lumberman Jacob Green Jackson?

entry.title: Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tural, the setting of the expansion pack Final Fantasy XIV: Dawntrail, is inspired by Latin America and Southeast Asia?

entry.title: Adnan al-Bursh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that orthopedic surgeon Adnan al-Bursh had also served as an advisor to the Palestine national football team before dying in an Israeli prison?

entry.title: American Colossus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that American Colossus is a biography of a man who was "the most famous sportsman in the world" and "the most forgotten great athlete in American history"?

entry.title: Edward M. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that husband and wife Edward M. and Marie Zimmerman co-wrote the suffragist anthem "Votes for Women: Suffrage Rallying Song"?

entry.title: monitor payphones for vandalism (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that between 1985 and 1988, Televerket spent 2 million kronor paying youth sports teams to monitor payphones for vandalism?
